Authors: Hidajat M., Supria, Luwinda F.A., Sanjaya H.
Title: Emotional Speech Classification Application Development Using Android Mobile Applications
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Supria, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sanjaya, H., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) has become popular as it is believed to be able to improve company performance. One of the features of CRM are customer satisfaction level analyses. It is a verbal communication means of sending or receiving information. There are several intonations spoken during verbal communication that reflect the emotional state. Therefore, it can be used to get information regarding the level of customer satisfaction. Sound is one type of digital data that can be processed for an emotional state of classification. In this research, the authors decided to develop a mobile application that is integrated with machine learning to record a sound and classify it into a particular emotional state. This application is believed to be able to improve the user experience and simplify the installation to improve communication engagement. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Information management; Mobile computing; Public relations; Sales; Application development; component; Customer relationship management; formatting; Mobile applications; style; styling; Verbal communications; Customer satisfaction

Authors: Bachtiar M.R., Gusti D.N., Wijaya I., Hidajat M.
Title: Web-Based Application Development for False Images Detection for Multi Images Through Demosaicing Detection
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Bachtiar, M.R., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gusti, D.N., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, I., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Image manipulation techniques are getting common among communities causing the growth of hoax information. Various algorithms began to be developed with the aim of detecting fake images and one of them is detection trace demosaicing techniques. The demosaicing trace detection technique works by reading the changes that occur in the color values within the image area that have been forged. This research aim to create web-based application to detecting fake images by combining web technology and algorithm. In this research, the web application managed to produce an accuracy of 72 percent in detecting fake images. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Applications; Information management; Trace analysis; Websites; Demosaicing; false; image; Image manipulation; Trace detection; WEB application; Web technologies; Web-based applications; Web services

Authors: Yesmaya V., Ronald A., Hidajat M.
Title: Property exhibition decision support system based on web application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ronald, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Complexity in finding property on property exhibition which consider many related constraints is quite high. Customers need to spend much time to analyse the right property to buy depends on their constraints whether salary, distance to work, facility, etc. According to the problem, this research will collect the information from customer on property exhibition to find out the constraint. Also, this research will focus on design and analyses the decision support system for property exhibition. Software development life cycle that will be used is scrum which is divided into several processes like backlog, sprints, scrum meetings, and demos. The result of this research is a web application that help customer to collect the information of the property according to their constraints. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Decision support system; Property exhibition; Scrum

Authors: Panindriya V., Ashari J., Alessandra C., Hidajat M.
Title: Development of criminal spot mapping mobile application for travelling security
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Panindriya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ashari, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alessandra, C., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Crime in the streets in Indonesia is a very serious problem and has become a great concern for the Government. Evert year the crime rate is increasing. One of the method to reduce it is by increase community awareness and increase response time of crime detection. The research objective is to develop an android-based application to monitor the safety of its user while traveling. With this application, user's inner circle can monitor their trip location and status therefore increasing the cautiousness. In addition, user can also find crime spots that will be passed while doing trips and share information to other users about crime spots. The methodology used in this application is data collection method, literature studies, and through questionnaires. The method used to develop the program is Scrum. The result of the development is an android-based application. The conclusions of this development are the application is expected to increase community awareness and to reduce the crime rate in Indonesia. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Computer software; Information management; Mobile security; Surveys; Crime detection; criminal; Data collection method; Literature studies; mobile; Mobile applications; Research objectives; security; Crime

Authors: Adrianto D., Hidajat M., Yesmaya V.
Title: Augmented reality using Vuforia for marketing residence
Source title: 2016 1st International Conference on Game, Game Art, and Gamification, ICGGAG 2016
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The concept of Augmented Reality is a technology in which the interaction between the human-computer that can generate two-dimensional or three dimensional object in real time. Augmented reality can provide the necessary functions and information in its application. In this case the augmented reality (AR) just need a tool like a camera that can capture images by detecting the object without the marker coordinates from the surrounding environment to make real 3D objects. Augmented Reality application development is simple and easy to develop, so it can serve as a promotional tool or the provision of information. Therefore, the notion obtained separately develop AR applications that help the residence marketing department in the home market to show a 3D object of marketed house. So that prospective buyers get the information more interactive with real look 3D objects. This study use a software named Vuforia (QCAR) to implement augmented reality in mobile applications for marketing residence. Vuforia provides convenience to the Android mobile platform in the shooting in 3D objects. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: android; augmented reality; markerless; marketing residence; real environment; vuforia
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Application programs; Commerce; Human computer interaction; Marketing; Object detection; android; Augmented reality applications; Markerless; Marketing departments; Real environments; Surrounding environment; Three-dimensional object; vuforia; Augmented reality

Authors: Adam A.R., Hidajat M., Danaparamita M., Stevanus B., Wijayakusuma A., Christian
Title: Plant encyclopedia with image matching on a web-based application: Evaluation and implementation of SURF algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adam, A.R., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Stevanus, B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijayakusuma, A., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Christian, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The Plantcyclopedia application is developed to provide plant information. The difference between this research application and others is the search feature based on an image. The search feature is designed to match the shape and orientation. This application uses a Speeded Up Robust Features (SURF) algorithm to conduct the matching feature process. The SURF algorithm is divided into three main steps. The first step is to retrieve the image information and turn it into a matrix, using a Hessian - Laplace Technique to define the feature point following the integral to reduce the computational time. It also uses a Difference of Gaussian in order to handle the object with an invariant scale. This process is called Fast Hessian. The second step is to define the orientation of the image using a Haar Wavelet Responses Technique. The third step is to match the feature points from both images using a four dimensional vector and K-Means as a classification technique. The result of this research is an application which is able to collect plant information using image matching. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Web services; CBIR; Classification technique; Dimensional vectors; encyclopedia; Research applications; Speeded up robust features; SURF; Web-based applications; Image matching

Authors: Bahana R., Nurhudatiana A., Hidajat M., Budiono T.A.
Title: Who Recognized Fake Image Better: A Comparison Study between Human and Computer
Affiliations: Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Information Systems Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Bahana, R., Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Nurhudatiana, A., Information Systems Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiono, T.A., Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Along with the rapid development of multimedia and information technology in the recent years, a large number of photos and videos can be easily created and distributed by each and every member of our society. Some of these images are genuine, while some others have gone through modifications. Although the creation and posting of edited photographs in media are basically not prohibited, it becomes a problem when they are used improperly. Until now, the common practice in Indonesia when assessing whether an image has been modified or is original is still heavily dependent on human expert assessment that could be subjective. This research offers an alternative solution that is objective by developing a systematic image analysis method for distinguishing between original and modified image. The method utilizes high-level feature, namely the metadata of the image file, to differentiate between original and modified image. A prototype system was implemented in Visual Basic as a desktop application. The application used MS Windows GDI+. This prototype application can be used as a reliable and faster means to assist in fake image detection. However, as metadata-based analysis only detects whether a photograph has possibly been edited and it does not show which part of the photograph has been manipulated, future work includes development of pixel-based analysis approach. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Metadata; Photography; Alternative solutions; Analysis approach; Comparison study; Desktop applications; High-level features; Image analysis method; Image detection; Prototype system; Image analysis
Funding Text 1: This research is supported by DIKTI Hibah Bersaing research funding 2016.
